Award.AwardTitle: Travel support for US participants in the trimester "Analysis in Quantum Information Theory" at the Institute Henri Poincare
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the program "Analysis in Quantum Information Theory" that will be held the Institut Henri Poincare during the fall of 2017.

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the field of Quantum Information Theory. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this long-term conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at: www.ihp.fr/en/CEB/T3-2017.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of this project was to support participation of the United States based mathematical scientists in the trimester "Analysis in Quantum Information Theory"  held at the Institut Henri Poincare (IHP) in Paris, France, from September 4th to December 15th, 2017.  The trimester (web site: http://www.ihp.fr/en/CEB/T3-2017) was a major interdisciplinary event involving hundreds of mathematicians, physicists and computer scientists. Its  program included an introductory summer school and three one-week long conferences, about 100 hours of courses and mini-courses, numerous seminars, collaborative research, and outreach activities. In all, 26 scientists who participated in the trimester have been supported, with the bulk of the funds going to early career scientists, members of underrepresented groups, and researchers with no active research grants. 

Mastering quantum technologies is one of the major scientific and engineering challenges of the 21st century.  They have the potential to completely transform the way humans process information by introducing novel methods of computation, data transmission and encryption. A theoretical basis of this endeavor, quantum information theory (QIT), is a rapidly developing interdisciplinary field connecting mathematics, computer science and physics. Conversely, the impact of quantum information science on the diverse subfields of mathematics has been significant in the last few years. The program at IHP was focused on the interactions between QIT and broadly understood analysis. It created a framework for establishing and strengthening numerous collaborations, often across disciplinary boundaries. Some of these collaborations already resulted in publications, a few of which are listed below, and more will be undoubtedly forthcoming.

[1] Li Gao, Samuel J. Harris, Marius Junge, Quantum Teleportation and Super-dense Coding in Operator Algebras, arxiv:1709.02785

[2] Elizabeth S. Meckes and Mark W. Meckes, Random matrices with prescribed eigenvalues and expectation values for random quantum states, arxiv:1711.02710

[3] Ben Li, Exact values of quantum violations in low-dimensional Bell correlation inequalities, arxiv:1712.08506

[4] Adam Bene Watts, Aram W. Harrow, Gurtej Kanwar, Anand Natarajan, Algorithms, Bounds, and Strategies for Entangled XOR Games. 10th Innovations in Theoretical Computer Science, Art. No. 10, 18 pp., LIPIcs. Leibniz Int. Proc. Inform., 124, Schloss Dagstuhl. Leibniz-Zent. Inform., Wadern, 2019, arxiv:1801.00821

[5] Anand Natarajan and Thomas Vidick, Low-degree testing for quantum states, and a quantum entangled games PCP for QMA, 59th Annual IEEE Symposium on Foundations of Computer Science?FOCS 2018, 731?742, IEEE Computer Soc., Los Alamitos, CA, 2018. DOI 10.1109/FOCS.2018.00075, arxiv:1801.03821

[6] Ramon Flores, Delaram Kahrobaei and Thomas Koberda, Algorithmic problems in right-angled Artin groups: complexity and applications. J. Algebra 519 (2019), 111-129, arxiv:1802.04870

[7] Li Gao, Marius Junge, and Nicolas LaRacuente, Fisher Information and Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality for Matrix Valued Functions,  arxiv:1807.08838
